bug.author: haomengchao
bug.description:
Hi, thank you for sharing the code. I trained FCN32s on VOC12 and got the correct results when using view_log. However, when I tried to draw the learning curves, my log couldn't work with the code. After , all the data in became NaN. Is there something wrong with my log? There are some pics about this problem. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31341358/41076832-2170871a-6a46-11e8-9bdf-a55f3170838b.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31341358/41076839-295d0e80-6a46-11e8-8147-aa3d6b075adc.png></denchmark-link>
Do you know how to fix it? Thank you very much. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wkentaro>@wkentaro</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Hmm, I have no idea. If you provide me the log.csv, I think I can get to know the cause.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/wkentaro>@wkentaro</denchmark-link> sorry to disturb you. How can I provide it to you? Thanks
I usually use gist for that. You can also use Dropbox and Google Drive.

I post it on Google Drive <denchmark-link:https://drive.google.com/open?id=13Yv1i7yNnsxl2fjcQHvw5xlkUkgB5IzO>https://drive.google.com/open?id=13Yv1i7yNnsxl2fjcQHvw5xlkUkgB5IzO</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/wkentaro>@wkentaro</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/wkentaro/pytorch-fcn/commit/697f8647bb3fcd4f3af27eda0931f350017a7573>697f864</denchmark-link> should fix this issue. So please use the latest pytorch-fcn by .
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/wkentaro>@wkentaro</denchmark-link> yeah the bug is fixed. Thank you!
